name: Pech Lithlord
description: The Pech Lithlord is a small elemental creature characterized by its affinity for stone and robust defense. It has a solid build and is often seen manipulating the earth around it.
memorable: Its unique ability to stun foes and its connection to the earth make it a formidable guardian of natural elements.
goals: To protect natural environments, especially those involving stone.
relations: Might be found alongside other elementals or druids, serving as guardians of nature.
environment: Typically inhabits rocky terrains or caverns, where stone is abundant.
strengths: Strong physical attacks and effective spellcasting capabilities.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to bright light, which impairs its effectiveness.
attacks: Uses a multiattack strategy with a pick and a hammer, capable of stunning targets.
most_powerful_ability: Ability to stun enemies with its multiattack when two successful hits occur on the same target.
senses: Possesses darkvision up to 120 feet and a passive perception of 17, enhancing its awareness of the surroundings.
skills: Proficient in athletics and perception, both at +7, demonstrating agility and keen awareness.
additional_information: Immune to poison damage and several conditions.
Can cast useful spells like Mending and Thunderwave at will.
Has the ability 'One with the Stone' for damage resistance.
Excels in rocky or stony environments where its abilities shine.
Neutral good alignment compels it to defend nature.
spellcasting: Innate spellcasting based on Wisdom, including utility and damaging spells.

elemental with light sensitivity and stunning attacks
